results.title: Nvidia Stock Forecast: Bracing for a Pullback Amid AI Headwinds - TipRanks
results.content:
Sheryl ShethFeb 02, 2026, 07:17 PM

Nvidia’s (NVDA) dominance in artificial intelligence (AI) chips faces growing challenges that could weigh on its stock price in 2026. As the AI sector’s bellwether, Nvidia’s shares have dropped 7.6% over the past three months, outpacing the Nasdaq’s (NDX) 1.6% decline. Currently trading around $191, the stock has pulled back from its 52-week high of $212.

### Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

 Unlock  hedge fund-level data  and  powerful investing tools  for smarter, sharper decisions
 Stay ahead of the market with  the latest news and analysis  and maximize your portfolio's potential

## Nvidia Stock Performance [...] ## Financial Strength and Analyst Outlook

Nvidia posted 62% revenue growth to $57.01 billion in its October quarter, with net income up 65% to $31.91 billion. Analysts project fiscal 2026 revenue of over $212 billion, with AI spending set to rise 30% in 2026-2027. A projected $3 trillion global data center wave further cements long-term demand for GPUs.

## Is NVDA a Strong Buy?

Analysts remain highly optimistic about Nvidia’s long-term outlook. On TipRanks, NVDA stock commands a Strong Buy consensus rating based on 38 Buys, one Hold, and one Sell rating. The average Nvidia price target of $262.79 implies 37.5% upside potential from current levels. Over the past year, NVDA stock has surged 63.8%.

See more NVDA analyst ratings

Disclaimer & DisclosureReport an Issue

1 [...] Counterbalancing these headwinds are strong growth drivers. The shift to “Agentic AI” and upcoming Rubin platform production should fuel Nvidia’s long-term rally, even amid recent valuation concerns. Nvidia’s GPUs maintain a clear edge in AI parallel processing over CPUs, solidifying its leadership position. Moreover, the reopening of the lucrative Chinese market, with orders for over 2 million H200 chips from giants like Alibaba (BABA) and ByteDance, bolsters its outlook.

results.title: Nvidia Stock Drops on Report of Paused $100 Billion OpenAI Deal - Yahoo Finance
results.content:
The Wall Street Journal reported that discussions between Nvidia and OpenAI have slowed, citing people familiar with the matter. Nvidia had said in September it could invest up to $100 billion in the artificial intelligence company and help build large-scale computing capacity.

results.title: Nvidia Stock Dips On OpenAI Funding Issues - Investor's Business Daily
results.content:
BREAKING: Palantir Jumps Late, Leads Big Earnings Movers

 Technology

# Nvidia Stock Dips On OpenAI Funding Issues

Nvidia (NVDA) stock dipped Monday on conflicting news reports that the artificial intelligence chipmaker lacked confidence in major customer OpenAI and might have doubts about how much to fund it.

The Wall Street Journal reported Friday that Nvidia's plan to invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI to help it train and run AI models had stalled. Nvidia insiders expressed doubts about the deal, announced last September, the article said.

 ###### Take a Trial Today [...] On Sunday in Taipei, Huang told reporters that the proposed $100 billion investment in OpenAI was "never a commitment" and that the chipmaker would consider any funding rounds "one at a time," Bloomberg reported.

## Nvidia Stock Is On Four IBD Lists

In a client note Monday, Wedbush Securities analyst Dan Ives said investors are nervous about Nvidia's circular financing deals and concerns that OpenAI is "too big to fail." Still, he maintained his outperform rating on Nvidia stock with a price target of 230.

On the stock market today, Nvidia stock slid 2.9% to close at 185.61.

Nvidia stock is in a 13-week consolidation pattern with a buy point of 212.19, according to MarketSurge charts. That buy point is also the stock's all-time high, reached on Oct. 29.

results.title: Nvidia Stock Investors Got Great News From Palantir and Teradyne - The Motley Fool
results.content:
## Nvidia reports its quarterly earnings on Feb. 25

Nvidia is scheduled to report its fourth-quarter and full-year fiscal 2026 (ended in late January) results on Wednesday, Feb. 25, after the market close. (It generally releases its results at 4:20 p.m. ET, in my observation.) An earnings call with analysts is scheduled for 5 p.m. ET the same day.

For Q4, management guided for revenue of $65 billion, representing year-over-year growth of 65%. It also guided (albeit indirectly, through several inputs) for adjusted EPS of $1.50, representing 69% growth.

results.title: Can AI Demand Drive NVDA Stock To $240? - Forbes
results.content:
2022 Inflation Shock

 NVDA stock declined by 66.4% from a high of $33.38 on 29 November 2021 to $11.23 on 14 October 2022 compared to a peak-to-trough decrease of 25.4% for the S&P 500.
 However, the stock fully rebounded to its pre-Crisis high by 25 May 2023
 Since then, the stock has climbed to a peak of $207.04 on 29 October 2025, and is currently trading at $185.61

2020 Covid Pandemic

 NVDA stock saw a drop of 37.6% from a peak of $7.87 on 19 February 2020 to $4.91 on 16 March 2020 compared to a peak-to-trough decline of 33.9% for the S&P 500.
 However, the stock completely recovered to its pre-Crisis peak by 11 May 2020

2008 Global Financial Crisis [...] PROMOTED

Let’s delve into details of each of the assessed factors, but before that, for quick background: With $4.5 Tril in market capitalization, NVIDIA provides graphics, computing, and networking solutions for the gaming, visualization, datacenter, and automotive industries globally, with a strategic partnership with Kroger Co.

 But, the stock fully regained its pre-Crisis peak by 13 May 2016

However, the risk does not solely stem from major market downturns. Stocks can decline even when markets are performing well – think of events such as earnings reports, business updates, and outlook revisions.
